Need help with-

  • Providing meals and grocery items to women working in different area of gurugram Haryana

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Mask distribution, food distribution, providing oxygen cylinder, medicine, and spreading awareness in Jharkhand
  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Agadhbodh-Foundation-768171233228908/

data.Name: Migrant Workers Solidarity Network (MWSN)

childMarkdownRemark.html:
* MWSN is running a national level helpline for distressed workers, mostly coming from marginalised backgrounds. The helpline started in March 2020 in 10 different languages during the first Covid-19 induced lockdown. In the first phase of lockdown they were able to assist in over 40,000 cases.

Distribution of dry ration in slums for urban poor.

Return tickets of distressed Migrant Workers and direct cash transfer to workers and daily wagers in urgent cases.

Essential healthcare supplies to stranded workers.

data.Name: Help The Tribal Communities of Odisha Battle Covid-19
Category: Relief to dalit and adivasi communities

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• A team will work in cooperation with Niyamgiri Surakhya Samiti, putting greater emphasis on COVID preventive and curative measures.
  • In the Dongria villages, people also have high cases of malaria. The team in Niyamgiri will address the rising cases of malaria along with COVID-19 and any other illness that needs immediate attention.
  • Individual contributions only

data.Name: Relief Appeal for Cyclone Yaas

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• The state Fishworkers Union is raising funds for relief and rehabilitation work.
  • The coastal districts of Purba Medinipur and South 24 Parganas have seen widespread flooding, leading to extensive destruction of fishing gear and livelihood spaces (ponds, agrarian lands)
  • Raising funds for:
    • Repair of boats
    • Replacement of nets
    • Stocking fish in pukurs (fresh water ponds)

The account is strictly for Indian donors.

data.Name: Help Daily Wage Earner Transwomen In Shillong, Meghalaya

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Help raise funds to help 20 transwomen from Shillong who have lost their job due to the ongoing lockdown.
  • They used to work at tea-shop or cafeteria as waitress; beautician at beauty parlours and as househelp. They had migrated from various parts of Meghalaya to find opportunities in the capital Shillong.
  • I intend to raise Rs 160000 to help them with their Rent + Dry Ration + Medicines and other sanitary and hygiene needs.

data.Name: Raising funds for two Covid patients in Meerut

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Raising funds for medical expenses for two COVID positive patients in Meerut, UP who are in need of urgent hospitalisation. Neelam, 51 and Maya, 75+ years of age
  • Mr. Arora is the sole earning member of the family and only got discharged the day before yesterday. As it stands, the family has no way to afford the treatment cost for two of its other members.
  • The attendant, Mr. Arora's niece, Aarti has been running from pillar to post to take care of all three patients simultaneously. Besides her, there is only her brother who is still very young and cannot possibly take care of any of these patients by himself.
  • The family will need these funds in the next four days

data.Name: Help Mohammad Shah Battle Black Fungus Infection

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Just as Mohammad Salim Shah (67 yrs old) was recovering from covid19 in April this year, he suffered a massive heart attack. The bypass surgery could not be conducted due to severity of black fungus infection that had spread to his bones. A temporary angioplasty was done at the time.

In May and June we raised money to pay for treatment of the infection and fortunately, the doctors were able to bring it under control.

On 9th July, Shah was taken for a check up and an angiography was done. The results show extremely critical condition as blockage is building up again and the first angioplasty will not hold out for much longer. An operation to insert two stents is now urgently required.

Shah's son Mudassar has been taking care of him since March and hasn't been able to attend work. Without his salary, his finances have fast depleted. Your help will be greatly appreciated.

data.Name: Financial support to Akash Gosh for Covid treatment

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Akash has been hospitalized since 16/04/21 in a critical situation. His 2 lungs are critically damaged.
  • A few days back he lost his father due to covid. His family is now unable to bear the hospital charges.
  • His friend, Sunny is collecting donations for his medical expense.

data.Name: Support Liza and Her Family of 5
Category: Financial Distress after Death in Family

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Liza lost her father due to covid-19, who was a retired JVN teacher who didn't receive a pension.
  • She needs funds to assist her family of 5, including herself, her 3 sisters and her mother

data.Name: Cyclone Yaas- People Of Sundarbans Needs All Of You

childMarkdownRemark.html: We are looking for the following support. 1. Empty cement bag which will be used for rebuilding river embankments. 2. Water for drinking purpose 3. Tarpaulins and Mosquito Nets 4. Dry ration and food support 5. Clothes and utensils 6. Hygiene materials 7. Bleaching 8. Mask and Sanitizers

data.Name: Care for Manipur is Seeking Financial Support

childMarkdownRemark.html:
We have come together to help save lives during this pandemic by providing medical supplies and monetary aid, in line with and fully observing the guidelines laid down by the state authorities. We aim to raise INR 1 crore by 15th June, 2021 to meet the following objectives:

  • 25 concentrators
  • 200 oxygen cylinders
  • 10 ICU Beds

data.Name: Ranchi Support Group

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Ranchi Support Group is an off-shoot of Lahu bolega is a collective of individuals who started working in the domain of public health in Ranchi, Jharkhand (India)
  • We plan the reach 300 COVID-19 patients/ their families as per the plan.
  • Help will be given in the form of ration kits, Medicine, Medical costs
  • The identified government hospitals are Covid-19 Care Center Risaldar, Doranda, RIMS Ranchi, Sadar Hospital. 60 percent of the effort of the support provided by the collective will be concentrated here. The remaining 40 percent of the effort of the organization will be towards charitable hospitals like Sewa Sadan, K C Rai Memorial hospital etc in Ranchi

data.Name: Financial Help for Vijendra's  Family
Category: Financial Distress after Death in Family

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Vijendra's mother is no more and his family's financial condition is very poor.
  • They are not able to pay hospital bills as the family makes less than 1 lakh per annum
  • He is a BA student from Jaipur, Rajasthan.

His best friend Deepak Kumar has started this fundraiser to help them pay all the pending medical expenses and hospital bills.

data.Name: Support Aakash and his brother's education
Category: Financial Distress after Death in Family

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Aakash and his brother lost their father due to Covid-19. He was the sole earning member of the family and ran a small business that was facing losses.
  • He is enrolled as PGDM student in a college in Noida and his brother is in second year of engineering.
  • The funds raised from this will cover 2 years fees of his brother's fees and a year of his own.
  • Their fees have to be submitted by July, 2021

data.Name: Support The Society for Empowerment of the Deafblind

childMarkdownRemark.html:
The Society for Empowerment of the Deafblind” (SEDB), a registered Non-Governmental Organisation (NGO).

  • They are raising funds during this difficult time for the a new training centre for deafblind youth to train them. Along with a strong user-friendly informative website that will reach every Deafblind people in India
  • Donors can choose to-Sponsor a website payment or Sponsor a training (Education) or Sponsor Preparatory training amongst several other alternatives the details to which are in the fundraiser.

data.Name: Covid Prevention Action in Adivasi Villages (Oorus)
Category: Relief to dalit and adivasi communities

childMarkdownRemark.html: We request you to join hands with us to support the Adivasi settlements in equipping themselves to face this terrible situation of COVID 19

data.Name: My mother needs support for her treatment

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Patient in Century Hospital, Hyderabad for more than 25 days and fighting covid, her lungs are damaged.
  • Family has exhausted their savings

Patient Name: Vijaya Laxmi Place: Hyderabad Hospital Name: Century Hospital Patient's Daughter: Harika Xavier

data.Name: Support trans people & people living with HIV meet their livelihood

childMarkdownRemark.html:
We are an organisation called Jeeva, and we work in the state of Karnataka on the rights on gender and sexual minorities.

We provide legal empowerment and mental health support to the community. We provide rations, and work on community-driven sanitation improvement programs in deprived urban areas. We also lobby with the government to support the community.

We are seeking urgent support to provide dry rations and funds for rent for 1,000 community members, including trans people and people living with HIV.

data.Name: #HelpPahad Uttarakhand Calls for Donations

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Your donations will help us supply COVID support kits to villages in the hilly regions of Uttarakhand, which await basic medical equipment like oxymeters, thermometers etc. These kits will be supplied to ASHA health workers and village representatives to help track the health of patients and ensure timely intervention, as needed.

www.facebook.com/shegngo www.shegngo.com

data.Name: Durbar collecting funds for COVID-19 affected Sex Workers in West Bengal

childMarkdownRemark.html: Collecting funds for COVID-19 affected sex workers in West Bengal facing imminent hunger and destitution. Durbar, the sex workers' collective, is committed to fend for this group along with other marginalised communities.

data.Name: Save Daily Wage Earners and Migrants From Dying of Hunger in Jharkhand
Category: Relief to dalit and adivasi communities

childMarkdownRemark.html: Your funds will be used to provide ration kits to 2500 families of daily wage earners and migrants in Jharkhand for the next few months. Each kit contains rations to feed a family of four for 2 weeks and kits will be given out twice a month to each family. A ration kit for a family would cost Rs.1000 consisting of rice, dal, soybean, cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves, masala, salt,washing and bathing soap.

data.Name: Help Souradeep to Provide for His Aunt's Treatment

childMarkdownRemark.html: We are looking to raise funds for Mayuri Dutta who is admitted at Apollo Hospital, Kolkata. Her elder sister Kasturi Dasgupta had weak lungs so the entire family spent the last 15 months shielding her, protecting her and rallying around her. They moulded their lives keeping her safety in the centre of everything they did. However, Corona struck the Dasgupta household and in an unequal fight, took Kasturi away from everything she held dear. The day after her sad demise, Mayuri who is just 34 years old, also had breathing troubles. Though she was immediately admitted to an ICU facility, she spiralled very quickly into critical care and had to be housed in a ventilator. Her infection was uncontrolled, the lungs compromised and doctors had not seen too many success stories, once patients enter this stage. The only ray of hope was offered by a new technology, ECMO, that is giving young patients like Mayuri- one more chance to make it. An ECMO bed has been secured for her and she has now spent 4 days at the hospital fighting for her life. There is a long haul ahead. ECMO treatment is extremely expensive and our insurance coverage is inadequate. We know that we are clutching at straws here but its our only chance to return a semblance of normalcy to a family facing a bleak cruel future. We are raising funds to help fund Mayuri's treatment.

data.Name: Help Support My Father's Treatment

childMarkdownRemark.html: My father, Mr. Kamlesh Kumar Batra as he has been in the hospital due to Lungs Pnemonia since 7th April 2021. From last 1.5 months, my father has been struggling in the ICU for recovery. He is suffering from post-covid complications and now, due to some medical procedures in the ICU, he has also suffered with a significant brain damage. Because of which, he is now in a coma state. Our family has done all it can to collect the total amount required for the treatment but Rs 50 Lakhs more are required to pay for all the medical expenses. Sadly, my elder sister who was supporting the family financially had lost her job in last July due to Covid pandemic. Hence, we are very financially pressed.

data.Name: Help Riot Hit Familes of North East Delhi

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Neev has been helping riot-hit families of northeast Delhi since February 2020 with legal aid.
  • Now, however, they need funds to provide ration to 100 families hit due to covid.
  • Each kit will cost Rs 1200 and eat kit will last close to 2 weeks

data.Name: Support domestic workers in Bangalore through the COVID-19 crisis

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Under covid restrictions, many domestic workers living in informal settlements and neighborhoods with poor infrastructure, many of whom are senior citizens, single women, sole providers of their family, have lost their jobs and are struggling to make ends meet.
  • Grassroots social workers & local community leaders together are trying to support women in Bandepalya, Kundanahalli, Jakkasandra, and Nanjappa Garden with basic rations & medicines.
  • With no relief from the government (& lack of ration cards + ration provisions drastically cut) they don't have any other means for food in the coming weeks. All funds raised will go directly to pay for their rations.

data.Name: Mahila Kisan Adhikaar Manch (MAKAAM), Chhattisgarh

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• The livelihoods of rural women working as daily wage labourers, vegetable sellers, cultivators, domestic workers, etc. are under threat. Specifically, the condition of single, deserted and widowed women is extremely precarious.
  • In a forest of Kasdol block, Baloda Bazar district in Chhattisgarh, there are communities(who belong to certain tribes) that make their living by making bamboo utensils, which they are unable to sell due to the pandemic.
  • We plan to distribute kits would be containing essential supplies such as **rations, sanitary napkins, pulses/cereals, vegetables along with basic medical supplies such as oximeters (per cluster in each village), paracetamol, thermometers, etc. **
  • We are estimating the price to be around Rs. 1200 per person. We are hoping to reach out to 200 women farmers.

data.Name: Help Families Of Child Survivors Of Sexual Abuse Survive COVID Second Wave

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Child survivors of sexual abuse in Delhi are facing increased vulnerability due to the second wave of COVID-19.
  • Most of the children and their families are socio-economically disadvantaged and hence, face an exponentially increasing risk due to the pandemic and its impact on livelihoods.
  • Of the families, we aim to support through this fundraiser
  1. 90% have lost their jobs and are struggling to find odd jobs that help them make their ends meet.
  2. 98% live on rent and are unable to afford it.
  3. 18% of the families have children as the sole earners.
  • Your donations to this fundraiser will help 55 families of child survivors of sexual abuse and children in difficult circumstances by helping them stay afloat and pay for the basics of rent, medical care, education needs, and ration.

More information on donation platform

data.Name: Support Covid Relief in Bihar through Jan Jagran Shakti Sangathan

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Help JJSS run covid relief efforts in Araria, Katihar, Saharsa, and Kishanganj districts of Bihar.

JJSS' COVID relief work presently includes:

1. Vaccine Awareness and help desk 2. Making and distributing masks 3. Medical support 4. Food packet distribution 5. Advocating for NREGA entitlements to ensure local income security 6. Advocating for NFSA entitlements to ensure food security

Your donation will support the first four.

data.Name: Tarai Environment Awareness Samiti Supporting Migrants and Homeless

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Delivering ration Kits to the migrants
  • Ration kit to homeless people
  • Providing medicare services, Hand Sanitisers, Masks for free of cost to them.

data.Name: Oxygen SOS: Help Raise Funds for 500 BiPAP Ventilators

childMarkdownRemark.html:
There is only **1 Ventilator for 900 Covid+ people in New Delhi. ** Pledge with us to save lives in Delhi by donating BiPAP ventilators to public hospitals.

We are currently donating Spice Oxy ventilators to the hospitals through the Care Taking branch, Revenue Department, Delhi Govt through local suppliers at a cost of Rs. 99,500 + 12% GST.

Delhi has almost 10 lakh or 1 million Covid+ cases, but only 1168 ventilators. Let's save lives, one breath at a time! Donate now and help Delhi fight the Oxygen crisis and lowering the daily 400 death toll. We urge you to come together and save a million lives in Delhi. Help Delhi breathe and spread the word in your personal and professional network, and urge all institutions/companies/businesses to donate generously for Delhi Oxygen SOS.

Help Delhi Breathe & Survive! Umeed Project Team

data.Name: Help Hansaben fight COVID and pay her outstanding hospital bills

childMarkdownRemark.html: Hansaben and her husband were both COVID-positive and admitted in a private hospital as they were not able to find a bed in a government hospital. At the time of discharge, husband paid off his bill, but Hansaben's bill is still pending. Knowing their situation, the hospital has given them time to pay the bill. Their only son passed away a year back, and Hansaben and her do stitching work at home with very low income. All savings have been exhausted. She is still on oxygen support at home and needs medicine.

data.Name: Help Jyoti's mother recover from COVID-19 with pneumonia

childMarkdownRemark.html: Jyoti's mother was COVID-positive and had pneumonia. She was admitted in the ICU at Delhi Heart and Lungs Institute Hospital for 22 days. She has been discharged and her treatment continues at home. She is on oxygen support. Pneumonia, lung infection medicines and other medical expenses are very costly, and Jyoti is unable to cover it.

data.Name: Food for unemployed women's families in rural Jaipur

childMarkdownRemark.html: **Annapurna NGO, **in collaboration with Shakti Women Organisation, have initiated a 'Food For All’ campaign. They seek to provide 3 months dry ration kit to the families of around 200 unemployed women, who are otherwise daily wagers, living in villages near Jaipur - Hathi Gaon and Harmada. Each kit will cost Rs. 2500/- and will be directly distributed to the families.

data.Name: Trans Community Kitchen

childMarkdownRemark.html:
They are working towards- -homeless people, construction workers, working-class communities dwelling on the pavement, to access cheap or free food.

-The money helps them oversee the work they do in the comprehensive updates they provide to everyone who sends in any amount of money, and then contributing again in spaced-out intervals and telling friends & family.

data.Name: BAPSA is fundraising to provide medication for people in rural areas

childMarkdownRemark.html: BAPSA is an independent, Ambedkarite student organization comprising of students from marginalized backgrounds. They are fundraising to provide aid in the form of medication to people in rural areas whose livelihood has been adversely affected by the pandemic.

data.Name: Support to set up box hospitals in different parts of Bihar

childMarkdownRemark.html: We are looking to set up Box Hospitals of 50-bed facilities (COVID Recovery Centre for mild and moderate cases) in 10 districts of Bihar. The centre would be equipped with corrugated cardboard beds, medicine boxes, oxygen concentrators and separators. We will help the existing government hospital by increasing the capacity utilisation by providing beds, IV Stands, separators, medicine boxes and oxygen concentrators. The existing hospitals can run and manage the box hospital facility, and this would enable them to provide medical treatment to more number of patients and segregate mild and moderate cases.

data.Name: Support needed for women head affected families in Kallukuttai slum

childMarkdownRemark.html: The second lockdown has impacted families of daily wagers headed by women the most. They have no food or dry food materials, and require immunity boosters as well for weeks. To supply each household, INR 2000 or 30USD is necessary, for a total of 721 families in Kallukuttai, Chennai.

data.Name: Help A Community Overcome Covid Crisis

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Sathru Nayak is raising funds for his community which has been affected by coronavirus.
  • The funds will go into procuring medicines (Tablets, Remdesivirs for patients in hospital), Vegetables for 600 people, supporting wage laborers and landless laborers who have suffered a loss of income, and helping the elderly get medicines on time.

data.Name: Help Madhya Pradesh Fight Coronavirus

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• raising funds for oxygen concentrators for emergency cases; PPE Kits** for untested COVID-19 patients especially in village areas; and N-95 masks, sanitizers, and hand gloves **for frontline workers like ambulance drivers, food distributors, etc.
  • refilling of already procured oxygen cylinders** **
  • oximeters for patients in government hospitals who are left unattended, patients from poor economic backgrounds, and ASHA workers for frequent check-ups of patients in their areas.
  • prepare and distribute **500 food packets per day **for patient attendants in government hospitals.

data.Name: Covid Response 2.0 By Quarantined Student-Youth Network
Support for Sewer Workers and Waste Pickers of Delhi NCR

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Dalit Adivasi Shakti Adhikar Manch (DASAM) works with sewer workers and waste pickers, whose income has been severely impacted by COVID-19 and the lockdown. They are collecting funds through Magadh Foundation
  • Provide monetary assistance to minimum 200 families of waste pickers and sewage workers, most of whom are daily wagers, for essential supplies and medicine.
  • Provide dry ration to 100 such families

For donations of more than Rs. 5000, Copy of pan card is required. After making a donation, please send an email to dashaktimanch@gmail.com. They can provide an 80G certificate to anyone who needs one.

data.Name: Free Food Kitchen For Transgenders

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Group of 6 transgender individuals at Dinajpur came together and initiated, ICCHAPURON - Community based kitchen.
  • Community to support: Transgender individuals from the age bracket of 18 to 49 years living in and around Dinajpur district in India who are engaged in sex work. The project will also focus on following paraments;

1. Rural/Urban: Urban & Semi Urban 2. Socio-economic group: Lower middle class to living below poverty line 3. Occupational group: Sex workers 4. Identity: Transgender

  • Objectives: The overall objectives of the community kitchen are as follows:

1. Source of Income for Trans community members, and 2. Providing lifesaving food to needy individuals.

data.Name: Funds to Survive

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• The family has spent all their savings on medical treatment of multiple family members who were hospitalised due to COVID-19.
  • They are now finding it difficult to survive
  • Funds will pay bills and help his family during this hard time

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Preparing food for people, with each food packet consisting of 2 parathas (a type of bread) and 1 sachet of pickle.
  • FOR EVERY 20 RUPEES, YOU CAN FEED ONE PERSON.

data.Name: Support our sanitation workers

childMarkdownRemark.html: Ecolizer is working with 15 Urban Local Bodies (ULBs), coordinating the day to day activities of collecting, segregating, packaging and disposing for reuse or recycling the material waste that they are able to work with. We intend to provide the following: 1) PPE kits(including a full-body suit, gloves and mask) 2) Waterproof gumboots 3) Hand sanitizer **4) Liquid hand soap ** 5) Vitamin C tablets

data.Name: Funds For Those Affected By Garment Industry Shutdown During COVID

childMarkdownRemark.html: requesting financial help for workers in a garment startup who can no longer work due to COVID, and are unable to feed their families

data.Name: Begging Is No More An Option For US...

childMarkdownRemark.html: Groceries and medicine support for transgender and HIV positive people in Ulhasnagar, Kalyan and Bhiwandi, and Thane districts as they cannot beg for their livelihood due to the pandemic.

data.Name: Anhad Relief Second Appeal: Ration for Families in Distress

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• To reach out to families in distress who reside in areas where our volunteers stay.
  • To provide a basic ration kit containing rice, lentils and grain to more than 250 vulnerable families in various regions of India.

data.Name: Help Kalidevi Fight Covid-19

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Of the many families that have been disrupted by the pandemic, Kalidevi's has been too.
  • She has been admitted at Prithasavi Hospital since 2nd May, 2021 and the hospital bills are beyond what her family can afford.
  • Her husband being a low level contractor, doesn't make income where they could save much for future but only as much as they could spend for everyday expenses.
  • The funds that will be raised are utilized in medicines, hospital bed, daily medical tests, injections and oxygen cylinders.

data.Name: Mewar society needs donations

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• An NGO based in Rajasthan distributing food packets to families, children, and seniors who are food insecure.
  • focus area is in the rural areas of Udaipur and Chittorgarh Districts.
  • current reach is 15 villages within the Bhinder tehsil (Udaipur district) and Bhadesar tehsil (Chittorgarh district). There are over 100 villages and the need for emergency food assistance is much greater.

data.Name: Support Trans People In Rural Maharashtra Through The Pandemic

childMarkdownRemark.html: Raising ration funds for families in Nagar district who have lost their sources of income due to the pandemic.

data.Name: For The Future of Yash! An aspiring law student from Kasganj

childMarkdownRemark.html: Help Yash complete his education and become a Judge

data.Name: Join Hands With GreenCaps JSR Foundation To Raise Funds For COVID Relief

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Green Caps JsR Foundation has been involved in relief work from day one of the lockdown. We help people who are isolated, old or incapable of going out with any and all kind of emergency services right from medicines, grocery, fruits and vegetables, to helping them with transportation fr homes to hospitals and back.

There are many people in city who cannot afford basic meds, food and other costs that this pandemic has made difficult to bear. Keeping that in mind and with the very little help that we get beause of being a small city , we have initiated a small fundraiser to increase our reach to as many people as possible. Kindly help us in our fundraiser.

data.Name: Help Harish Sarafolu, Delhi Riots 2020 Victim, in re-building his Life

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Harish Sarafolu, lost sensation in his leg during an attack in Delhi Pogrom 2020 and to cover his medical expenses Harish borrowed over 50,000/- + interest.
  • Harish has been out of job since 2020 and losing sensation in his foot is unable to work at the majority of places.
  • Raise 80,000 to cover his loan and some money for daily ration.
  • It would be helpful if we can raise money for him to purchase an auto which costs 3.5 lakh, but understanding the current covid situation we are trying to raise 80,000.
  • If anyone would like to donate a second hand auto, please come forward

data.Name: Help baazigar magician families in Anand Parbat survive lockdown

childMarkdownRemark.html: There are 30 former baazigar magician families living in a temporary camp in Anand Parbat, New Delhi. Funds are being raised to provide the families with rations, essential medications, and masks, as they are unable to earn wages during the lockdown and are in dire need of assistance.

data.Name: Support Adivasi Community During The COVID-19 Pandemic
Category: Relief to dalit and adivasi communities

childMarkdownRemark.html:
The funds raised will go towards reducing the barriers to the provision of healthcare. These contributions will be directed to address to the following urgent requirements:

  • Gloves and sanitiser - Rs. 600 per pack
  • Medicine - Rs. 1000
  • Food supply for a COVID-19-positive patient or suspected positive patient in isolation - Rs. 1500 for 10 days
  • COVID-19 diagnostic tests for the community and hospital staff - Rs. 2500 per test
  • Diagnostic tests for other diseases/conditions to identify co- infection - Rs. 4000 per patient
  • Referral to higher tier hospital - Rs. 8000 per patient

data.Name: Raising money for uncle who is COVID +ve in Korba Chattisgarh

childMarkdownRemark.html: My uncle, Santosh Kumar Agrawal, is a covid patient in severe condition (SPO2 90, fever, not able to eat and high weakness). He is a shopkeeper in a small town (Korba, Chhattisgarh) with very limited basic earnings. He is not in a position to be shifted to hospital. So we are arranging medicines and setting up a medical facility for him. Please donate.

data.Name: O2 For Madras

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• O2 For Madras are calling for funds for Oxygen Cylinders and Concentrators as Covid cases skyrocketing in the Chennai, hospitals have been crippled by the lack of equipment.
  • They are calling out to anyone willing to sponsor for: Oxygen concentrator Rs 80,000. Oxygen cylinder (D type)- Rs 25,000

data.Name: Help set up Isolation Centres and Boat Ambulance service  in the Sunderbans

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Establishing Isolation Centres in Sunderbans area of West Bengal which will provide for isolation for patients with symptoms before hospitalization.
  • Starting boat ambulances with Purbo Sripotinagar village
  • Launch Covid-19 sensitization drive
  • Establish blood donation camps
  • Provide updated and verified information regarding hospital beds availability, oxygen availability, plasma availability, medicines availability, etc.
  • Organizing medical tests including oximeter checks.

data.Name: Help feed COVID affected communities in Bangalore

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• S Veena Sangama is a transgender activist based in Bengaluru, Karnataka.
  • She is organizing a drive across the city to distribute food to transgender communities, daily wage workers, elderly people, and other families and individuals affected by COVID-19.
  • They are preparing 50 kilograms of rice every day to prepare around 350 packs of food.
  • People are struggling to afford even one meal a day and heavily depend on Veena and her team's efforts.
  • Have raised 1,00,000 through direct transfer before moving onto Milaap due to increased need of funds

data.Name: Ration For Differently Abled People in Katedan, Hyderabad

childMarkdownRemark.html: • Provide ration kits to around 100 families in Katedan, Hyderabad

data.Name: Ration Kit Distribution Drive for Covid 19 Lockdown in Sunderbans

childMarkdownRemark.html: Aims to feed families in Sundarbans who are affected due to the COVID -19 lockdown. Swapnopuron Welfare Society is providing Ration Kits, which can feed a family for the next 30 days. The cost of a single Ration Kit is Rs. 500 only. Pack contains 5 Kg - Rice | 400 gms - Dal | 1 Litre - Mustard Oil | 1 Packet - Salt | Soyabean | Pack of surgical masks | Soaps

data.Name: Dr. Tushar Shah's COVID-19 relief fund

data.Name: Help feed 1500 underprivileged families for 3 months

They have distributed 2.5 Lakh meals and counting. Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/Hopebegins.org YouTube - https://youtube.com/channel/UCvLwDg6Cehh_QnD-EidHR2w Website - https://hopebegins.org.in/donate-us/

data.Name: Seeking financial help for Yousuf Beg's family

childMarkdownRemark.html: • We lost our friend and fellow activist, Yousuf Beg, from Panna district, Madhya Pradesh, to COVID. His family is now facing a deep financial crisis. He is survived by his wife, Sameena, who also lost her mother yesterday to COVID, and his two children Afreena and Faizal.

data.Name: Support vulnerable populations in Bhopal

childMarkdownRemark.html: Organizations that provide medical care and rehabilitation for gas and toxic water poisoned families in Bhopal free of cost are acting rapidly to organise a ‘community shield’ in acutely at-risk parts of the city to educate, monitor and intervene, in order to suppress transmission of the virus. Aided by hundreds of local volunteers, over the first nine months of the pandemic their efforts were able to limit infections in these communities to just thirty three people, all but two of whom recovered. Donations can be made easily and swiftly using the QR code below, or by the bank details provided.

data.Name: Help Srinivasa pay for his mother's Covid19 treatment

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Until last year, Srinivasa was working in the service sector in Bangalore. He lost his job due to lockdown and hasn't been able to find another one since.

Recently, both Srinivasa and his mother tested positive with Covid19. Unable to afford hospital treatment, they're both quarantining at home in Davanagere. They have been forced to borrow from neighbours for the most basic medication and home needs.

Srinivasa needs financial help to pay for medical treatment. His mental health and stress levels are also significantly high, making it harder for him to successfully find work.

  • They are seeking funds so that they can continue providing uninterrupted safety, food, medication, provisions, and access to trained support staff to their residents.

data.Name: [COVID-19] Help for Education and survival

Jitendra is survived by his 10 years old son, leaving no money his education or food. His son Sarthak is very talented, your donations will help Sarthak continue his education.

data.Name: Stranded Workers Action Network

childMarkdownRemark.html:

  • When you fill the form you will only be pledging an amount (no transfer)
  • As and when the team gets distress calls and requests, they will get in touch with you to make individual transfers directly to the migrant worker.

data.Name: Urgent Support Required for Transgender Persons in India

childMarkdownRemark.html:
How will your funds be used :

  1. Rent/Shelter support per person: 2500/- per month

  2. Ration & medicine/hygiene kit support per person: 2500/- per month

  3. Emergency/crisis support

We have been providing ration kits and some financial help to more than 1000 trans persons across the country

We are a collective of transgender persons who through this campaign are trying to facilitate the basic needs of our community members. We request everyone to come forward and support the community in whichever way possible.

data.Name: Help Set Up a COVID Medical Facility for the Villages of Faridabad

childMarkdownRemark.html:
We plan to set up a 25-bed facility on the campus of DAV Public School, Sector 14, Faridabad. There would be 10 oxygen care beds and 15 HDU (High Dependency Unit) beds. The facility will have a dedicated staff of doctors and nurses, and will provide medical care, medicines and food for the patients free of cost, and the prescribed tests at a subsidized rate.

We will have a team go to villages in collaboration with BK Hospital, Faridabad, and provide rapid antigen tests for people suspected to have COVID. We will initiate contact tracing for those who turn up positive, as well as makes sure that the patients have enough resources to stay in isolation. We will admit the patients who require hospitalization to the facility, and provide them with medical care for as long as required.

DAV Public School, Sector 14 will provide us space for setting up the facility, as well as rooms for the medical staff free of cost. We would need funds for the following:

  1. 10 oxygen beds
  2. 15 HDU beds
  3. Medicines
  4. Doctors and nursing staff

We have collaborated with a medical tech company to modify normal beds to ICU beds at a fraction of the cost of regularly produced ICU beds. We have also procured the necessary licenses and permissions for setting up the facility, as well as PPE kits for medical staff. The certification of the doctors to be involved, letter from DAV Public School to the CMO, BK Hospital, Faridabad for setting up the facility, as well as the waste management and water licenses have been attached for the perusal of the donors. All funds received will be transferred to DAV Sector 14 Faridabad's trust account, and updates would be provided on their expenditure.

data.Name: Support Kanchan Pal Recover From a Brain Stroke and Paralytic Attack

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Kirti is raising funds for her friend's father Kanchan Pal. He is 67 years old.
  • He is suffering from Brain Stroke, Paralytic Attack from the past few weeks.
  • He is currently admitted and receiving ICU Care in Tripura Medical College & Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Memorial, Agartala, Tripura.
  • Until now, they've spent about Rs. 1,00,000 and in the next 30 days, they need Rs.6,00,000 more for further treatment.

data.Name: Help Galanki Aierani Kumari Fight Covid19 & Mucormycosis

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• I am Galanki Arun Kamalakar raising funds for my mother Galanki Aierani Kumari's Covid19 & Mucormycosis (a Deadly Black Fungus) Treatment.
  • My mother's eye has is affected by black fungus infection.
  • Doctor told us that she require to undergo surgery and the estimated amount would be INR 25 Lakhs approximately, depending on recovery.
  • We have exhausted all savings in Covid Treatment and are unable to admit her due to lack of funds.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• My aunt Onimisha (age 52), lost her mother, Sushila Ghosh on 1st May due to Covid.
  • She has a 22-year-old autistic son with 65% permanent mental impairment due to which he is completely dependent on her.
  • My aunt is his only caretaker as she lost her husband in 2006 to blood cancer. Until now, she was taking care of her son along with her mother and managed all the finances using her mother's pension.
  • After her mother's death, she has no source of income left. She can't work as her son requires full-time attention.
  • She is in dire need of funds to sustain herself.

We will be providing rickshaw drivers with PPE kits, masks, and sanitizers too. Any help is appreciated. If you cannot help monetarily, please help us reach your rich friends with a big heart. Share this campaign with as many people as you can.

We will use the funds to procure essential equipment such as oxygen concentrators, CPAP machines, pulse oximeters, and medication, which will be handed over for deployment to a selection of trusted charities: Athrout, Help Poor Voluntary Trust, Social Reform Organisation and Voluntary Medical Trust.

UNITED SIKHS teams are working tirelessly on the ground to serve urgent life-saving needs.

data.Name: Seeking financial help for Taibun Nisha

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Taibun Nisha Mohammed Salim has a family of three children. She is originally from Jharkhand but has been living in Mumbai since her childhood.
  • She is a domestic worker in Mumbai, and her husband, who is an auto rickshaw driver, had to go back to his village to tend to his sick father.
  • Both of them are not earning anything anymore. Taibun along with her children, has gotten evicted twice, and they don’t have any means to pay their rent or buy groceries. This is a monthly bankroll of ₹10-12k to help them sustain till this ordeal passes over.

data.Name: COVID-19 Relief: Give Directly to Informal Waste Collectors

childMarkdownRemark.html:

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Per ration kit cost is Rs.750 and is of good quality which contains the following items- 5 KG Rice, 5 KG Flour, 2 KG Sugar, 1 KG Dal, 1 Packet Oil, 1 Packet Salt.
  • Provide Ramadan Kits, Senior Citizen Kits, Pregnant Mother Kits including nutritious items so they don't feel left out, this we do as per requirement arises.
  • Complete work can be found on Twitter handle @UmmatunnisaCare, which soon will be registered as an NGO "Ummatunnisa Care Foundation"

data.Name: Support Adivasi families of Gudalur tide over the CoVid-19 pandemic
Category: Relief to dalit and adivasi communities

childMarkdownRemark.html:
With support from 4 community-led organizations in Gudalur -- Adivasi Munnetra Sangam (AMS), ACCORD, ASHWINI and Vidyodaya, two volunteers in every Adivasi village has been identified - one to monitor the health status and the other the socio-economic status. The funds will be used for:

  1. **Addressing socio-economic needs **of 5000 families immediately that support their sustenance (for example, food, groceries, dry ration, personal hygiene necessities, transport costs etc). We also recognize the need to plan and prepare ourselves to support livelihood opportunities for the communities in their resilience & recovery post the pandemic. This would be at INR 1500 per family.
  2. Addressing the healthcare needs of these Adivasi communities through ASHWINI -- a community-run hospital making healthcare accessible and comprehensive for ~5000 Adivasi families -- by providing and strengthening preventive and curative care during this pandemic. (for example: procuring 1000 Personal Protective Equipments for healthcare professionals, medical supplies for the communities as well hospital needs, awareness campaigns and Mobile clinics etc) . Each PPE kit costs INR 800.

data.Name: Raising funds for Hardik Soin's family affected by COVID-19

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Hardik, a student of Class 12, is raising funds for his family to be able to pay

  • Rent
  • Food
  • Afford basic amenities
  • School fees

His parents have lost their income due to the pandemic. His mother is recovering from COVID-19 and has exhausted all her savings. The family urgently needs money.

data.Name: Help Baby Anaya's healthy transition into life

childMarkdownRemark.html: Asif’s daughter was born in the aftermath of the Delhi pogrom, during the COVID-19 lockdown, in 202. He had already been out of work since the pogrom, and did not have a stable source of income to support his child. Recently, his daughter was diagnosed with double aortic arch, which required urgent surgery. As he did not have the funds for this, and could not raise them in time, he had to borrow Rs 2.5 - 3 Lakhs from local lenders, which he has to return. His daughter continues to need medical assistance, and he has been reduced to borrowing money repeatedly. He is almost on the verge of handing over his property papers to save his daughter’s life. The fundraiser hopes to raise money for him so that he can at least clear off the acquired debt and sustain his family.

data.Name: Help rural India access medical oxygen cylinders

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Since rural India cannot afford a heavy security amount that goes from £100 (Around Rs 10,000) to £250 (Rs 25000) to secure one O2 cylinder, the campaign wants to bridge this inequality in access to healthcare.
  • Buying as many O2 cylinders and kits as possible from various sellers to send to India. This will benefit largely the Bahujans, including the NT-DNT communities.

data.Name: Donate now to save lives in Delhi NCR

childMarkdownRemark.html: This Delhi-based foundation has teams of on-ground volunteers working to supply oxygen cylinders, establish a COVID relief helpline, distribute PPE kits, end-to-end plasma donor support and other medical needs to marginalized people in the area.

data.Name: Help Poor Tribals (BPL) Terribly Hit by Pandemic: Food & Medical Aid

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• There is urgent need to Supply Food and medical aid to at least 1500 Tribal & Rural Families of Raigad (Maharashtra)
  • The Tribes of Raigad villages (Maharashtra) are mostly Daily-Wage Manual Laborers, from more than a month their daily income is gone, due to Coronavirus pandemic and they are left in extreme poverty and deprivation.
  • We are also providing relief in light of the Cyclone Tauktae in Gujarat, as well as providing COVID relief in Gujarat

data.Name: Mahila Patchwork Cooperative

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• It's primarily a low-income, Muslim majority municipality in Ahmedabad, with most people being daily wage earners. They do not have any money to buy any oxygen or medicine supplies. They are raising funds to provide the following to at least 2000 families:
    • ration: grains, pulses, oil, sugar, tea (costs Rs 1800/per family).
    • PPE kits gloves, masks, soaps, sanitizers (Costs Rs. 800/per family) , and
    • oxygen cylinders.

data.Name: Support economically weak and critical COVID affected families

childMarkdownRemark.html: JSF is springing back to help the underprivileged families suffering from #COVID to get through this crisis. We're starting[ #freeambulance](https://twitter.com/hashtag/freeambulance?src=hashtag_click) service for EWS patients and have raised money to hire a vehicle, pls donate to help us run more free ambulances

data.Name: Help Alizeh access gender-affirming procedures

childMarkdownRemark.html: Alizeh needs funds to access gender affirming procedures like laser treatment and hormone therapy

data.Name: Covid aid for Kinnar community, trans community and sex workers in Jharkhand

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• The fundraiser will go towards providing a ration kit costing Rs. 600, consisting of rice, dal, soybean, cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves, masala, salt, washing, and bathing soap
  • The livelihood of the transgender community and sex worker community in Jamshedpur is largely dependent on social interaction, such as dancing, sex work and begging, which have been impacted majorly by the pandemic
  • The transgender community is also battling discrimination, phobia, and stigma in healthcare along with a lack of adequate documentation or identity proof to avail benefits. With lack of food supplies, medicines, and money is the concern of the hour for the transgender community.

data.Name: Help us build our shelter for the trans community in West Bengal

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Moitrisanjog Society supports the transgender community in rural north Bengal. They have been trying to build a long-term shelter for older, homeless trans people so that they can live a safe and dignified life in a society that puts them through violence and discrimination.
  • The pandemic stalled the construction of the shelter, and at this last mile, they need your support to help finish building the shelter.

data.Name: Support Trans Men In Manipur Through Lockdown

childMarkdownRemark.html: • Trans men in Manipur are struggling to access basic needs and medication. ATMA has been self-sustaining for trans folks in their community, but many have lost their livelihoods due to the pandemic. They are fundraising now to support themselves and their families.

data.Name: Battling the second wave: SEWA Fundraiser (addressing emergency health needs; protecting livelihoods)

childMarkdownRemark.html: • Providing health kits (Rs.800) and food kits (Rs.1000) for about 2000 rural households at the moment.

data.Name: Help Sex workers and transgender persons fight Covid-19

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Support sex workers, sexual minorities and transgender persons across 10 districts of Karnataka with nutritional supplements in order to build their immunity given the impact of Covid-19. We plan to support at least 1000 every month.
  • Each nutritional supplement kit costs INR 250. For 1000 people for the next 10 months, this would cost INR 25 lakhs.
  • Website: http://sangama.org/

data.Name: Support for Manual Scavenging Maha Dalit women, Dalit community People.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Your contributions will strengthen efforts to support 7800 dalit women:

  • Distribute dry ration in slums for the urban poor.
  • Facilitate return journeys of stranded migrant workers.
  • Deliver essential healthcare supplies for Dalit women.

https://www.facebook.com/swabhimansociety/

data.Name: Help My Father Rajan Vinoth Raise Funds Fight Covid With Pneumonia

childMarkdownRemark.html: • Raising funds for Rajan Vinoth who is suffering from Severe Covid Pneumonia and he is on Ventilator since 25 days and he is undergoing treatment at Sri Ramachandra Hospital, Chennai.

data.Name: Food and Medicinal Resources for the Pardhi Community

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Amidst the pandemic, several people from the Pardhi community (a denotified tribe) in Bhopal and other districts of Madhya Pradesh have lost their lives due to lack of medicinal resources, insufficient food and income unavailability
  • Through Majal, the youth of the community are trying to crowdfund for food and medicinal resources

data.Name: Karishma - 18 years of being sick and I'm currently fighting for my life with Covid

childMarkdownRemark.html: Funds needed for medical expenses

data.Name: Dear Friends Please Donate For Poor People Ration kits

childMarkdownRemark.html: Ration kits for needy families

data.Name: Help lock-down affected Needy Families

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Monthly ration Kits, medicine and other essential items to 700 DAILY WAGER FAMILIES in Delhi NCR.
  • MORE INFO AND UPDATES AT: https://twitter.com/Khushbookhan_

data.Name: Help Covid-19 Affected People, Donate for Medicine, Food for the Needy

childMarkdownRemark.html: Feeds the needy and runs a weekend kitchen to give free food to the poor in Saharsa district of Bihar.

data.Name: BAPU Trust raising money for immediate food and support

childMarkdownRemark.html:
• Raising money for 80-100 low income households for food, safety or health care at approximately ₹2000 per household. Target: ₹2,00,000
  • Providing intensive care for 3 women who have no family or support, of which two have lost their jobs due to lockdown. Target: ₹2,50,000
